enableModule.text: This action is currently disabled, do you want to enable it?

resources.device_tip: Ring a VoIP or cell phone or other device
resources.name: Name
resources.expire_seconds_data_content: Enter the expiration time of this device (in seconds)
resources.closed_groups_data_content: If checked, this device will only be able to call the devices that are part of the same groups
resources.port_data_content: The destination server signaling port number
resources.server_data_content: The destination server domain or IP
resources.username_data_content: The authentication username used if challenged by the server
resources.password_data_content: The authentication password used if challenged by the server
resources.priority_data_content: The priority determines which carrier is tried first when multiple carriers are set up for the same rule (more than 1 10-digit US carrier, etc)
resources.enabled_data_content: When set to false this carrier will be ignored by the call routing engine
resources.realm_data_content: The authentication realm used if challenged by the server
resources.pass_realm_in_invite_data_content: Some upstream carriers need to know which specific customer is placing outbound calls. Activating this field puts the account realm into the From: header for all INVITEs so that the upstream carrier can tell which customer is actually making a call. Useful for billing and LCR purposes. WARNING: This also is used in authentication. If you are also authenticating the calls, this will change the authentication realm.
resources.rules_data_content: A regular expression used by the routine engine to determine when to use this carrier.
resources.prefix_data_content: Additional characters to prepend to the front of the dialed number
resources.suffix_data_content: Additional characters to append to the front of the dialed number
resources.progress_timeout_data_content: In secs, the maximum time to wait for media from a carrier gateway
resources.flags_help: You can list multiple flags by separating each flag with a comma
resources.type_data_content: An arbitrary caller-id type to search for when this route is used
resources.there_were_errors_on_the_form: There were errors on the form, please correct!
resources.are_you_sure_you_want_to_delete: Are you sure you want to delete this gateway?

mediaWebrtc.content: If checked, forces a WebRTC compatible SDP on the INVITE.
mediaWebrtc.label: WebRTC

resources.caller_id_name_data_content4: Define the Caller ID Name of this Device, to be used for P-Asserted-Identity header (max. 30 chars).
resources.caller_id_number_data_content4: Define the Caller ID Number of this Device, to be used for P-Asserted-Identity header.
resources.caller_id_realm_data_content4: Define the Caller ID Realm of this Device, to be used for P-Asserted-Identity header.

validation.name: Please only enter alphanumeric characters, space or comma

gateways.username: Please only enter alphanumeric characters, space or comma
gateways.password: Please enter a valid phone number
gateways.prefix: Please enter a valid prefix, ex. +234

oldResources.please_select_valid_number: Please select a valid number by click in the grey boxes of the Callflow box.
oldResources.this_callflow_has_not_been_created: This callflow has not been created or doesn\'t exist anymore.
oldResources.monster_callflow_error: This callflow was created via the Monster UI. At this time, the Kazoo UI callflow editor is not compatible to edit Monster-UI Callflows.
oldResources.are_you_sure: Are you sure you want to delete this callflow?
oldResources.giving_a_name_to_a_callflow: Giving a name to a callflow isn't mandatory. Leave the field blank and the callflow will be displayed in the left listing as the list of numbers used in this callflow.
oldResources.callflow_tip: Transfer the call to another call flow
oldResources.searchReset: Click again to clear the search
oldResources.__comment: UI-1742: Add a flag to list callflows in Main Numbers

applyTo.label: Apply To
applyTo.tooltip: Setting this field to "original" will revert the caller id and then apply the prepend, IE: if the caller id is already prepend'd then that will be lost. Setting it to "current" will keep the caller id as is, including any existing prepend, and simply add to it.

__comment: UI-1260: created common control for carrier selection

entityManager.header: Click the below resource to configure:
entityManager.__comment: UI-2612: add toggle to hide/view system callflows

showSystemCallflows.title: Show All Callflows
showSystemCallflows.help: As an admin, you're allowed to see all the existing callflows in this page. This include "Applications" Callflows that are created by other apps, but that you don't necesserarily want to update. If you wish to reduce clutter, you can switch this off to hide these callflows.

node.confirmEnable: This node is disabled. Do you want to enable it?
